Classes/AWSSESSendBounceResponse.html#/c.name: messageId
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceResponse.html#/c.abstract: The message ID of the bounce message.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.name: bounceSender
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.abstract: The address to use in the “From” header of the bounce message. This must be an identity that you have verified with Amazon SES.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.name: bounceSenderArn
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.abstract: This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization policy that permits you to use the address in the “From” header of the bounce. For more information about sending authorization, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.name: bouncedRecipientInfoList
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.abstract: A list of recipients of the bounced message, including the information required to create the Delivery Status Notifications (DSNs) for the recipients. You must specify at least one BouncedRecipientInfo in the list.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.name: explanation
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.abstract: Human-readable text for the bounce message to explain the failure. If not specified, the text is auto-generated based on the bounced recipient information.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.name: messageDsn
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.abstract: Message-related DSN fields. If not specified, Amazon SES chooses the values.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.name: originalMessageId
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html#/c:.abstract: The message ID of the message to be bounced.

Classes/AWSSESSNSDestination.html#/c:obj.name: topicARN
Classes/AWSSESSNSDestination.html#/c:obj.abstract:
The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic for email sending events. You can find the ARN of a topic by using the ListTopics Amazon SNS operation.

For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the Amazon SNS Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSNSAction.html#/c:objc(cs).name: encoding
Classes/AWSSESSNSAction.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification. UTF-8 is easier to use, but may not preserve all special characters when a message was encoded with a different encoding format. Base64 preserves all special characters. The default value is UTF-8.

Classes/AWSSESSNSAction.html#/c:objc(cs).name: topicArn
Classes/AWSSESSNSAction.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify. You can find the ARN of a topic by using the ListTopics operation in Amazon SNS.

For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the Amazon SNS Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.name: bucketName
Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.abstract: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for incoming email.

Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.name: kmsKeyArn
Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.abstract:
The customer master key that Amazon SES should use to encrypt your emails before saving them to the Amazon S3 bucket. You can use the default master key or a custom master key that you created in Amazon Web Services KMS as follows:

  • To use the default master key, provide an ARN in the form of arn:aws:kms:REGION:ACCOUNT-ID-WITHOUT-HYPHENS:alias/aws/ses. For example, if your Amazon Web Services account ID is 123456789012 and you want to use the default master key in the US West (Oregon) Region, the ARN of the default master key would be arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:123456789012:alias/aws/ses. If you use the default master key, you don’t need to perform any extra steps to give Amazon SES permission to use the key.

  • To use a custom master key that you created in Amazon Web Services KMS, provide the ARN of the master key and ensure that you add a statement to your key’s policy to give Amazon SES permission to use it. For more information about giving permissions, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

For more information about key policies, see the Amazon Web Services KMS Developer Guide. If you do not specify a master key, Amazon SES does not encrypt your emails.

Your mail is encrypted by Amazon SES using the Amazon S3 encryption client before the mail is submitted to Amazon S3 for storage. It is not encrypted using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. This means that you must use the Amazon S3 encryption client to decrypt the email after retrieving it from Amazon S3, as the service has no access to use your Amazon Web Services KMS keys for decryption. This encryption client is currently available with the Amazon Web Services SDK for Java and Amazon Web Services SDK for Ruby only. For more information about client-side encryption using Amazon Web Services KMS master keys, see the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.name: objectKeyPrefix
Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.abstract: The key prefix of the Amazon S3 bucket. The key prefix is similar to a directory name that enables you to store similar data under the same directory in a bucket.

Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.name: topicArn
Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html#/c:objc(cs)A.abstract:
The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the message is saved to the Amazon S3 bucket. You can find the ARN of a topic by using the ListTopics operation in Amazon SNS.

For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the Amazon SNS Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html#/c:.name: lastFreshStart
Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html#/c:.abstract:
The date and time at which the reputation metrics for the configuration set were last reset. Resetting these metrics is known as a fresh start.

When you disable email sending for a configuration set using UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled and later re-enable it, the reputation metrics for the configuration set (but not for the entire Amazon SES account) are reset.

If email sending for the configuration set has never been disabled and later re-enabled, the value of this attribute is null.

Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html#/c:.name: reputationMetricsEnabled
Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html#/c:.abstract:
Describes whether or not Amazon SES publishes reputation metrics for the configuration set, such as bounce and complaint rates, to Amazon CloudWatch.

If the value is true, reputation metrics are published. If the value is false, reputation metrics are not published. The default value is false.

Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html#/c:.name: sendingEnabled
Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html#/c:.abstract: Describes whether email sending is enabled or disabled for the configuration set. If the value is true, then Amazon SES sends emails that use the configuration set. If the value is false, Amazon SES does not send emails that use the configuration set. The default value is true. You can change this setting using UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled.

Classes/AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetReque.name: ruleNames
Classes/AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetReque.abstract: The specified receipt rule set’s receipt rules, in order.

Classes/AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetReque.name: ruleSetName
Classes/AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetReque.abstract: The name of the receipt rule set to reorder.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: action
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract: The action performed by the reporting mail transfer agent (MTA) as a result of its attempt to deliver the message to the recipient address. This is required by RFC 3464.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: diagnosticCode
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract: An extended explanation of what went wrong; this is usually an SMTP response. See RFC 3463 for the correct formatting of this parameter.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: extensionFields
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract: Additional X-headers to include in the DSN.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: finalRecipient
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract:
The email address that the message was ultimately delivered to. This corresponds to the Final-Recipient in the DSN. If not specified, FinalRecipient is set to the Recipient specified in the BouncedRecipientInfo structure. Either FinalRecipient or the recipient in BouncedRecipientInfo must be a recipient of the original bounced message.

Do not prepend the FinalRecipient email address with rfc 822;, as described in RFC 3798.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: lastAttemptDate
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract: The time the final delivery attempt was made, in RFC 822 date-time format.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: remoteMta
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract: The MTA to which the remote MTA attempted to deliver the message, formatted as specified in RFC 3464 (mta-name-type; mta-name). This parameter typically applies only to propagating synchronous bounces.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.name: status
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html#/c.abstract: The status code that indicates what went wrong. This is required by RFC 3464.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata.htm.name: createdTimestamp
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata.htm.abstract: The date and time the receipt rule set was created.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata.htm.name: name
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata.htm.abstract:
The name of the receipt rule set. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Start and end with a letter or number.

  • Contain 64 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.name: actions
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: An ordered list of actions to perform on messages that match at least one of the recipient email addresses or domains specified in the receipt rule.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.name: enabled
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If true, the receipt rule is active. The default value is false.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.name: name
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.abstract:
The name of the receipt rule. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), dashes (-), or periods (.).

  • Start and end with a letter or number.

  • Contain 64 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.name: recipients
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The recipient domains and email addresses that the receipt rule applies to. If this field is not specified, this rule matches all recipients on all verified domains.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.name: scanEnabled
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If true, then messages that this receipt rule applies to are scanned for spam and viruses. The default value is false.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.name: tlsPolicy
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Specifies whether Amazon SES should require that incoming email is delivered over a connection encrypted with Transport Layer Security (TLS). If this parameter is set to Require, Amazon SES bounces emails that are not received over TLS. The default is Optional.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptIpFilter.html#/c:ob.name: cidr
Classes/AWSSESReceiptIpFilter.html#/c:ob.abstract: A single IP address or a range of IP addresses to block or allow, specified in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. An example of a single email address is 10.0.0.1. An example of a range of IP addresses is 10.0.0.1/24. For more information about CIDR notation, see RFC 2317.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptIpFilter.html#/c:ob.name: policy
Classes/AWSSESReceiptIpFilter.html#/c:ob.abstract: Indicates whether to block or allow incoming mail from the specified IP addresses.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptFilter.html#/c:objc.name: ipFilter
Classes/AWSSESReceiptFilter.html#/c:objc.abstract: A structure that provides the IP addresses to block or allow, and whether to block or allow incoming mail from them.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptFilter.html#/c:objc.name: name
Classes/AWSSESReceiptFilter.html#/c:objc.abstract:
The name of the IP address filter. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Start and end with a letter or number.

  • Contain 64 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: addHeaderAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Adds a header to the received email.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: bounceAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Rejects the received email by returning a bounce response to the sender and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: lambdaAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Calls an Amazon Web Services Lambda function, and optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon SNS.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: s3Action
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Saves the received message to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon SNS.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: SNSAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Publishes the email content within a notification to Amazon SNS.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: stopAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Terminates the evaluation of the receipt rule set and optionally publishes a notification to Amazon SNS.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.name: workmailAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html#/c:objc.abstract: Calls Amazon WorkMail and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Amazon SNS.

Classes/AWSSESRawMessage.html#/c:objc(cs.name: data
Classes/AWSSESRawMessage.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract:
The raw data of the message. This data needs to base64-encoded if you are accessing Amazon SES directly through the HTTPS interface. If you are accessing Amazon SES using an Amazon Web Services SDK, the SDK takes care of the base 64-encoding for you. In all cases, the client must ensure that the message format complies with Internet email standards regarding email header fields, MIME types, and MIME encoding.

The To:, CC:, and BCC: headers in the raw message can contain a group list.

If you are using SendRawEmail with sending authorization, you can include X-headers in the raw message to specify the “Source,” “From,” and “Return-Path” addresses. For more information, see the documentation for SendRawEmail.

Do not include these X-headers in the DKIM signature, because they are removed by Amazon SES before sending the email.

For more information, go to the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.name: identity
Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.abstract:
The identity to which that the policy applies. You can specify an identity by using its name or by using its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Examples: user@example.com, example.com, arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com.

To successfully call this operation, you must own the identity.

Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.name: policy
Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.abstract:
The text of the policy in JSON format. The policy cannot exceed 4 KB.

For information about the syntax of sending authorization policies, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.name: policyName
Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.abstract:
The name of the policy.

The policy name cannot exceed 64 characters and can only include alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.

Classes/AWSSESPutConfigurationSetDeliver.name: deliveryOptions
Classes/AWSSESPutConfigurationSetDeliver.abstract: Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS).

Classes/AWSSESMessageTag.html#/c:objc(cs.name: name
Classes/AWSSESMessageTag.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract:
The name of the tag. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Contain 256 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESMessageTag.html#/c:objc(cs.name: value
Classes/AWSSESMessageTag.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract:
The value of the tag. The value must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Contain 256 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html#/c:objc(cs.name: arrivalDate
Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: When the message was received by the reporting mail transfer agent (MTA), in RFC 822 date-time format.

Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html#/c:objc(cs.name: extensionFields
Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Additional X-headers to include in the DSN.

Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html#/c:objc(cs.name: reportingMta
Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: The reporting MTA that attempted to deliver the message, formatted as specified in RFC 3464 (mta-name-type; mta-name). The default value is dns; inbound-smtp.[region].amazonaws.com.

Classes/AWSSESMessage.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.name: subject
Classes/AWSSESMessage.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.abstract: The subject of the message: A short summary of the content, which appears in the recipient’s inbox.

Classes/AWSSESListVerifiedEmailAddresses.name: verifiedEmailAddresses
Classes/AWSSESListVerifiedEmailAddresses.abstract: A list of email addresses that have been verified.

Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesResponse.html.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesResponse.html.abstract: A token indicating that there are additional email templates available to be listed. Pass this token to a subsequent call to ListTemplates to retrieve the next set of email templates within your page size.

Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesResponse.html.name: templatesMetadata
Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesResponse.html.abstract: An array the contains the name and creation time stamp for each template in your Amazon SES account.

Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesRequest.html#.name: maxItems
Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesRequest.html#.abstract: The maximum number of templates to return. This value must be at least 1 and less than or equal to 100. If more than 100 items are requested, the page size will automatically set to 100. If you do not specify a value, 10 is the default page size.

Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesRequest.html#.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListTemplatesRequest.html#.abstract: A token returned from a previous call to ListTemplates to indicate the position in the list of email templates.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRespons.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRespons.abstract: A token indicating that there are additional receipt rule sets available to be listed. Pass this token to successive calls of ListReceiptRuleSets to retrieve up to 100 receipt rule sets at a time.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRespons.name: ruleSets
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRespons.abstract: The metadata for the currently active receipt rule set. The metadata consists of the rule set name and the timestamp of when the rule set was created.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRequest.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRequest.abstract: A token returned from a previous call to ListReceiptRuleSets to indicate the position in the receipt rule set list.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptFiltersResponse.name: filters
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptFiltersResponse.abstract: A list of IP address filter data structures, which each consist of a name, an IP address range, and whether to allow or block mail from it.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesRespon.name: policyNames
Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesRespon.abstract: A list of names of policies that apply to the specified identity.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesReques.name: identity
Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesReques.abstract:
The identity that is associated with the policy for which the policies are listed. You can specify an identity by using its name or by using its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Examples: user@example.com, example.com, arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com.

To successfully call this operation, you must own the identity.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest.html.name: identityType
Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest.html.abstract: The type of the identities to list. Possible values are “EmailAddress” and “Domain”. If this parameter is omitted, then all identities are listed.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest.html.name: maxItems
Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest.html.abstract: The maximum number of identities per page. Possible values are 1-1000 inclusive.

Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.name: customVerificationEmailTemplates
Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: A list of the custom verification email templates that exist in your account.

Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: A token indicating that there are additional custom verification email templates available to be listed. Pass this token to a subsequent call to ListTemplates to retrieve the next 50 custom verification email templates.

Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.name: maxResults
Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: The maximum number of custom verification email templates to return. This value must be at least 1 and less than or equal to 50. If you do not specify a value, or if you specify a value less than 1 or greater than 50, the operation returns up to 50 results.

Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: An array the contains the name and creation time stamp for each template in your Amazon SES account.

Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsRespo.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsRespo.abstract: A token indicating that there are additional configuration sets available to be listed. Pass this token to successive calls of ListConfigurationSets.

Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsReque.name: maxItems
Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsReque.abstract: The number of configuration sets to return.

Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsReque.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsReque.abstract: A token returned from a previous call to ListConfigurationSets to indicate the position of the configuration set in the configuration set list.

Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html#/c:objc(.name: functionArn
Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Lambda function. An example of an Amazon Web Services Lambda function ARN is arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:account-id:function:MyFunction. For more information about Amazon Web Services Lambda, see the Amazon Web Services Lambda Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html#/c:objc(.name: invocationType
Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract:
The invocation type of the Amazon Web Services Lambda function. An invocation type of RequestResponse means that the execution of the function immediately results in a response, and a value of Event means that the function is invoked asynchronously. The default value is Event. For information about Amazon Web Services Lambda invocation types, see the Amazon Web Services Lambda Developer Guide.

There is a 30-second timeout on RequestResponse invocations. You should use Event invocation in most cases. Use RequestResponse only to make a mail flow decision, such as whether to stop the receipt rule or the receipt rule set.

Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html#/c:objc(.name: topicArn
Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the Lambda action is executed. You can find the ARN of a topic by using the ListTopics operation in Amazon SNS.

For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the Amazon SNS Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination.name: deliveryStreamARN
Classes/AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination.abstract: The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream that email sending events should be published to.

Classes/AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination.name: IAMRoleARN
Classes/AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination.abstract: The ARN of the IAM role under which Amazon SES publishes email sending events to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttrib.name: verificationStatus
Classes/AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttrib.abstract: The verification status of the identity: “Pending”, “Success”, “Failed”, or “TemporaryFailure”.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttrib.name: verificationToken
Classes/AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttrib.abstract: The verification token for a domain identity. Null for email address identities.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: bounceTopic
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon SES publishes bounce notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: complaintTopic
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon SES publishes complaint notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: deliveryTopic
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon SES publishes delivery notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: forwardingEnabled
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: Describes whether Amazon SES forwards bounce and complaint notifications as email. true indicates that Amazon SES forwards bounce and complaint notifications as email, while false indicates that bounce and complaint notifications are published only to the specified bounce and complaint Amazon SNS topics.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: headersInBounceNotificationsEnabled
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in Amazon SNS notifications of type Bounce. A value of true specifies that Amazon SES includes headers in bounce notifications, and a value of false specifies that Amazon SES does not include headers in bounce notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: headersInComplaintNotificationsEnabled
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in Amazon SNS notifications of type Complaint. A value of true specifies that Amazon SES includes headers in complaint notifications, and a value of false specifies that Amazon SES does not include headers in complaint notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: headersInDeliveryNotificationsEnabled
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in Amazon SNS notifications of type Delivery. A value of true specifies that Amazon SES includes headers in delivery notifications, and a value of false specifies that Amazon SES does not include headers in delivery notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.name: behaviorOnMXFailure
Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.abstract:
The action that Amazon SES takes if it cannot successfully read the required MX record when you send an email. A value of UseDefaultValue indicates that if Amazon SES cannot read the required MX record, it uses amazonses.com (or a subdomain of that) as the MAIL FROM domain. A value of RejectMessage indicates that if Amazon SES cannot read the required MX record, Amazon SES returns a MailFromDomainNotVerified error and does not send the email.

The custom MAIL FROM setup states that result in this behavior are Pending, Failed, and TemporaryFailure.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.name: mailFromDomain
Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.abstract: The custom MAIL FROM domain that the identity is configured to use.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.name: mailFromDomainStatus
Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.abstract: The state that indicates whether Amazon SES has successfully read the MX record required for custom MAIL FROM domain setup. If the state is Success, Amazon SES uses the specified custom MAIL FROM domain when the verified identity sends an email. All other states indicate that Amazon SES takes the action described by BehaviorOnMXFailure.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.name: dkimEnabled
Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.abstract: Is true if DKIM signing is enabled for email sent from the identity. It’s false otherwise. The default value is true.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.name: dkimTokens
Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.abstract:
A set of character strings that represent the domain’s identity. Using these tokens, you need to create DNS CNAME records that point to DKIM public keys that are hosted by Amazon SES. Amazon Web Services eventually detects that you’ve updated your DNS records. This detection process might take up to 72 hours. After successful detection, Amazon SES is able to DKIM-sign email originating from that domain. (This only applies to domain identities, not email address identities.)

For more information about creating DNS records using DKIM tokens, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.name: dkimVerificationStatus
Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.abstract: Describes whether Amazon SES has successfully verified the DKIM DNS records (tokens) published in the domain name’s DNS. (This only applies to domain identities, not email address identities.)

Classes/AWSSESGetTemplateResponse.html#/.name: template
Classes/AWSSESGetTemplateResponse.html#/.abstract: The content of the email, composed of a subject line and either an HTML part or a text-only part.

Classes/AWSSESGetTemplateRequest.html#/c.name: templateName
Classes/AWSSESGetTemplateRequest.html#/c.abstract: The name of the template to retrieve.

Classes/AWSSESGetSendStatisticsResponse..name: sendDataPoints
Classes/AWSSESGetSendStatisticsResponse..abstract: A list of data points, each of which represents 15 minutes of activity.

Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html#.name: max24HourSend
Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html#.abstract: The maximum number of emails the user is allowed to send in a 24-hour interval. A value of -1 signifies an unlimited quota.

Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html#.name: maxSendRate
Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html#.abstract:
The maximum number of emails that Amazon SES can accept from the user’s account per second.

The rate at which Amazon SES accepts the user’s messages might be less than the maximum send rate.

Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html#.name: sentLast24Hours

To successfully call this operation, you must own the identity.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityPoliciesRequest.abstract: A list of the names of policies to be retrieved. You can retrieve a maximum of 20 policies at a time. If you do not know the names of the policies that are attached to the identity, you can use ListIdentityPolicies.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAtt.name: identities
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAtt.abstract: A list of one or more identities. You can specify an identity by using its name or by using its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Examples: user@example.com, example.com, arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.name: mailFromDomainAttributes
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.abstract: A map of identities to custom MAIL FROM attributes.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.name: identities
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.abstract: A list of one or more identities.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.name: dkimAttributes
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.abstract: The DKIM attributes for an email address or a domain.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.name: identities
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.abstract: A list of one or more verified identities - email addresses, domains, or both.

Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.name: failureRedirectionURL

Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.name: fromEmailAddress

Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.name: successRedirectionURL

Classes/AWSSESGetAccountSendingEnabledRe.name: enabled
Classes/AWSSESGetAccountSendingEnabledRe.abstract: Describes whether email sending is enabled or disabled for your Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

Classes/AWSSESExtensionField.html#/c:obj.name: name
Classes/AWSSESExtensionField.html#/c:obj.abstract: The name of the header to add. Must be between 1 and 50 characters, inclusive, and consist of alphanumeric (a-z, A-Z, 0-9) characters and dashes only.

Classes/AWSSESExtensionField.html#/c:obj.name: value
Classes/AWSSESExtensionField.html#/c:obj.abstract: The value of the header to add. Must contain 2048 characters or fewer, and must not contain newline characters (“\r” or “\n”).

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.name: cloudWatchDestination
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.abstract: An object that contains the names, default values, and sources of the dimensions associated with an Amazon CloudWatch event destination.

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.name: enabled
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.abstract: Sets whether Amazon SES publishes events to this destination when you send an email with the associated configuration set. Set to true to enable publishing to this destination; set to false to prevent publishing to this destination. The default value is false.

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.name: kinesisFirehoseDestination
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.abstract: An object that contains the delivery stream ARN and the IAM role ARN associated with an Amazon Kinesis Firehose event destination.

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.name: matchingEventTypes
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.abstract:
The type of email sending events to publish to the event destination.

  • send - The call was successful and Amazon SES is attempting to deliver the email.

  • reject - Amazon SES determined that the email contained a virus and rejected it.

  • bounce - The recipient’s mail server permanently rejected the email. This corresponds to a hard bounce.

  • complaint - The recipient marked the email as spam.

  • delivery - Amazon SES successfully delivered the email to the recipient’s mail server.

  • open - The recipient received the email and opened it in their email client.

  • click - The recipient clicked one or more links in the email.

  • renderingFailure - Amazon SES did not send the email because of a template rendering issue.

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.name: name
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.abstract:
The name of the event destination. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Contain 64 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.name: SNSDestination
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html#/c:o.abstract: An object that contains the topic ARN associated with an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) event destination.

Classes/AWSSESDestination.html#/c:objc(c.name: bccAddresses
Classes/AWSSESDestination.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The recipients to place on the BCC: line of the message.

Classes/AWSSESDestination.html#/c:objc(c.name: ccAddresses

Classes/AWSSESDestination.html#/c:objc(c.name: toAddresses

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.name: deliveryOptions

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.name: eventDestinations

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.name: reputationOptions

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.name: trackingOptions

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.name: configurationSetAttributeNames
Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.abstract: A list of configuration set attributes to return.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.name: configurationSetName
Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.abstract: The name of the configuration set to describe.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeActiveReceiptRuleS.name: metadata
Classes/AWSSESDescribeActiveReceiptRuleS.abstract: The metadata for the currently active receipt rule set. The metadata consists of the rule set name and a timestamp of when the rule set was created.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeActiveReceiptRuleS.name: rules

Classes/AWSSESDeliveryOptions.html#/c:ob.abstract: Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is Require, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is Optional, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can’t be established.

Classes/AWSSESDeleteVerifiedEmailAddress.name: emailAddress
Classes/AWSSESDeleteVerifiedEmailAddress.abstract: An email address to be removed from the list of verified addresses.

Classes/AWSSESDeleteReceiptRuleSetReques.name: ruleSetName
Classes/AWSSESDeleteReceiptRuleSetReques.abstract: The name of the receipt rule set to delete.

Classes/AWSSESDeleteIdentityRequest.html.name: identity

Classes/AWSSESDeleteIdentityPolicyReques.name: identity

Classes/AWSSESDeleteIdentityPolicyReques.abstract: The name of the policy to be deleted.

Classes/AWSSESDeleteCustomVerificationEm.name: templateName

Classes/AWSSESDeleteConfigurationSetRequ.abstract: The name of the configuration set to delete.

Classes/AWSSESDeleteConfigurationSetEven.name: configurationSetName

Classes/AWSSESDeleteConfigurationSetEven.abstract: The name of the event destination to delete.

Classes/AWSSESCustomVerificationEmailTem.name: fromEmailAddress

  • Start and end with a letter or number.

Classes/AWSSESCreateReceiptRuleRequest.h.abstract: The name of an existing rule after which the new rule is placed. If this parameter is null, the new rule is inserted at the beginning of the rule list.

Classes/AWSSESCreateReceiptRuleRequest.h.abstract: A data structure that contains the specified rule’s name, actions, recipients, domains, enabled status, scan status, and TLS policy.

Classes/AWSSESCreateReceiptRuleRequest.h.name: ruleSetName
Classes/AWSSESCreateReceiptRuleRequest.h.abstract: The name of the rule set where the receipt rule is added.

Classes/AWSSESCreateReceiptFilterRequest.name: filter
Classes/AWSSESCreateReceiptFilterRequest.abstract: A data structure that describes the IP address filter to create, which consists of a name, an IP address range, and whether to allow or block mail from it.

Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.name: failureRedirectionURL
Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his or her address is not successfully verified.

Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.name: fromEmailAddress
Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.

Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.name: successRedirectionURL
Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his or her address is successfully verified.

Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.name: templateContent
Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: The content of the custom verification email. The total size of the email must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with some limitations. For more information, see Custom Verification Email Frequently Asked Questions in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.name: templateName
Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: The name of the custom verification email template.

Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.name: templateSubject
Classes/AWSSESCreateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: The subject line of the custom verification email.

Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetTrac.name: configurationSetName
Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetTrac.abstract: The name of the configuration set that the tracking options should be associated with.

Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetTrac.name: trackingOptions
Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetTrac.abstract:
A domain that is used to redirect email recipients to an Amazon SES-operated domain. This domain captures open and click events generated by Amazon SES emails.

For more information, see Configuring Custom Domains to Handle Open and Click Tracking in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetRequ.name: configurationSet
Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetRequ.abstract: A data structure that contains the name of the configuration set.

Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEven.name: configurationSetName
Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEven.abstract: The name of the configuration set that the event destination should be associated with.

Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEven.name: eventDestination
Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEven.abstract: An object that describes the Amazon Web Services service that email sending event where information is published.

Classes/AWSSESConfigurationSet.html#/c:o.name: name
Classes/AWSSESConfigurationSet.html#/c:o.abstract:
The name of the configuration set. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Contain 64 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.name: defaultDimensionValue
Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.abstract:
The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch if you do not provide the value of the dimension when you send an email. The default value must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), dashes (-), at signs (@), or periods (.).

  • Contain 256 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.name: dimensionName
Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.abstract:
The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), dashes (-), or colons (:).

  • Contain 256 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.name: dimensionValueSource
Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.abstract: The place where Amazon SES finds the value of a dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, specify messageTag. To use your own email headers, specify emailHeader. To put a custom tag on any link included in your email, specify linkTag.

Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDestination.html.name: dimensionConfigurations
Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDestination.html.abstract: A list of dimensions upon which to categorize your emails when you publish email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch.

Classes/AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest.name: originalRuleSetName
Classes/AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest.abstract: The name of the rule set to clone.

Classes/AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest.name: ruleSetName
Classes/AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest.abstract:
The name of the rule set to create. The name must meet the following requirements:

  • Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).

  • Start and end with a letter or number.

  • Contain 64 characters or fewer.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.name: error
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.abstract: A description of an error that prevented a message being sent using the SendBulkTemplatedEmail operation.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.name: messageId
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.abstract: The unique message identifier returned from the SendBulkTemplatedEmail operation.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.name: status
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.abstract:
The status of a message sent using the SendBulkTemplatedEmail operation.

Possible values for this parameter include:

  • Success: Amazon SES accepted the message, and attempts to deliver it to the recipients.

  • MessageRejected: The message was rejected because it contained a virus.

  • MailFromDomainNotVerified: The sender’s email address or domain was not verified.

  • ConfigurationSetDoesNotExist: The configuration set you specified does not exist.

  • TemplateDoesNotExist: The template you specified does not exist.

  • AccountSuspended: Your account has been shut down because of issues related to your email sending practices.

  • AccountThrottled: The number of emails you can send has been reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending limit.

  • AccountDailyQuotaExceeded: You have reached or exceeded the maximum number of emails you can send from your account in a 24-hour period.

  • InvalidSendingPoolName: The configuration set you specified refers to an IP pool that does not exist.

  • AccountSendingPaused: Email sending for the Amazon SES account was disabled using the UpdateAccountSendingEnabled operation.

  • ConfigurationSetSendingPaused: Email sending for this configuration set was disabled using the UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled operation.

  • InvalidParameterValue: One or more of the parameters you specified when calling this operation was invalid. See the error message for additional information.

  • TransientFailure: Amazon SES was unable to process your request because of a temporary issue.

  • Failed: Amazon SES was unable to process your request. See the error message for additional information.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html#.name: destination
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html#.abstract:
Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and BCC: fields.

Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in RFC6531. For this reason, the email address string must be 7-bit ASCII. If you want to send to or from email addresses that contain Unicode characters in the domain part of an address, you must encode the domain using Punycode. Punycode is not permitted in the local part of the email address (the part before the @ sign) nor in the “friendly from” name. If you want to use Unicode characters in the “friendly from” name, you must encode the “friendly from” name using MIME encoded-word syntax, as described in Sending raw email using the Amazon SES API. For more information about Punycode, see RFC 3492.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html#.name: replacementTags
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html#.abstract: A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using SendBulkTemplatedEmail. Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish email sending events.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html#.name: replacementTemplateData
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html#.abstract: A list of replacement values to apply to the template. This parameter is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.

Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.name: bounceType
Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.abstract: The reason for the bounce. You must provide either this parameter or RecipientDsnFields.

Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.name: recipient
Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.abstract: The email address of the recipient of the bounced email.

Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.name: recipientArn
Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.abstract: This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization policy that permits you to receive email for the recipient of the bounced email. For more information about sending authorization, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.name: recipientDsnFields
Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html#.abstract: Recipient-related DSN fields, most of which would normally be filled in automatically when provided with a BounceType. You must provide either this parameter or BounceType.

Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.name: message
Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract: Human-readable text to include in the bounce message.

Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.name: sender
Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract: The email address of the sender of the bounced email. This is the address from which the bounce message is sent.

Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.name: smtpReplyCode
Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract: The SMTP reply code, as defined by RFC 5321.

Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.name: statusCode
Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract: The SMTP enhanced status code, as defined by RFC 3463.

Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.name: topicArn
Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html#/c:objc(.abstract:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the bounce action is taken. You can find the ARN of a topic by using the ListTopics operation in Amazon SNS.

For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the Amazon SNS Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESBody.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSE.name: html
Classes/AWSSESBody.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSE.abstract: The content of the message, in HTML format. Use this for email clients that can process HTML. You can include clickable links, formatted text, and much more in an HTML message.

Classes/AWSSESBody.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSE.name: text
Classes/AWSSESBody.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSE.abstract: The content of the message, in text format. Use this for text-based email clients, or clients on high-latency networks (such as mobile devices).

Classes/AWSSESAddHeaderAction.html#/c:ob.name: headerName
Classes/AWSSESAddHeaderAction.html#/c:ob.abstract: The name of the header to add to the incoming message. The name must contain at least one character, and can contain up to 50 characters. It consists of alphanumeric (a–z, A–Z, 0–9) characters and dashes.

Classes/AWSSESAddHeaderAction.html#/c:ob.name: headerValue
Classes/AWSSESAddHeaderAction.html#/c:ob.abstract: The content to include in the header. This value can contain up to 2048 characters. It can’t contain newline (\n) or carriage return (\r) characters.

Classes/AWSSESAddHeaderAction.html.name: AWSSESAddHeaderAction
Classes/AWSSESAddHeaderAction.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action adds a header to the received email.

For information about adding a header using a receipt rule, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESBody.html.name: AWSSESBody
Classes/AWSSESBody.html.abstract: Represents the body of the message. You can specify text, HTML, or both. If you use both, then the message should display correctly in the widest variety of email clients.

Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html.name: AWSSESBounceAction
Classes/AWSSESBounceAction.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action rejects the received email by returning a bounce response to the sender and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

For information about sending a bounce message in response to a received email, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html.name: AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo
Classes/AWSSESBouncedRecipientInfo.html.abstract:
Recipient-related information to include in the Delivery Status Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your behalf bounces.

For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html.name: AWSSESBulkEmailDestination
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestination.html.abstract: An array that contains one or more Destinations, as well as the tags and replacement data associated with each of those Destinations.

Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.name: AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus
Classes/AWSSESBulkEmailDestinationStatus.abstract: An object that contains the response from the SendBulkTemplatedEmail operation.

Classes/AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest.name: AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest
Classes/AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetRequest.abstract: Represents a request to create a receipt rule set by cloning an existing one. You use receipt rule sets to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESCloneRecei.name: AWSSESCloneReceiptRuleSetResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESCloneRecei.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDestination.html.name: AWSSESCloudWatchDestination
Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDestination.html.abstract:
Contains information associated with an Amazon CloudWatch event destination to which email sending events are published.

Event destinations, such as Amazon CloudWatch, are associated with configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.name: AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
Classes/AWSSESCloudWatchDimensionConfigu.abstract:
Contains the dimension configuration to use when you publish email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch.

For information about publishing email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESConfigurationSet.html.name: AWSSESConfigurationSet
Classes/AWSSESConfigurationSet.html.abstract:
The name of the configuration set.

Configuration sets let you create groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send using Amazon SES. For more information about using configuration sets, see Using Amazon SES Configuration Sets in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESContent.html.name: AWSSESContent
Classes/AWSSESContent.html.abstract:
Represents textual data, plus an optional character set specification.

By default, the text must be 7-bit ASCII, due to the constraints of the SMTP protocol. If the text must contain any other characters, then you must also specify a character set. Examples include UTF-8, ISO-8859-1, and Shift_JIS.

Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEven.name: AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest
Classes/AWSSESCreateConfigurationSetEven.abstract: Represents a request to create a configuration set event destination. A configuration set event destination, which can be either Amazon CloudWatch or Amazon Kinesis Firehose, describes an Amazon Web Services service in which Amazon SES publishes the email sending events associated with a configuration set. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESDeliveryOptions.html.name: AWSSESDeliveryOptions

Classes/AWSSESDescribeConfigurationSetRe.abstract: Represents the details of a configuration set. Configuration sets enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleRequest.name: AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleRequest
Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleRequest.abstract: Represents a request to return the details of a receipt rule. You use receipt rules to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleRespons.name: AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleResponse
Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleRespons.abstract: Represents the details of a receipt rule.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleSetRequ.name: AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleSetRequest
Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleSetRequ.abstract: Represents a request to return the details of a receipt rule set. You use receipt rule sets to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleSetResp.name: AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleSetResponse
Classes/AWSSESDescribeReceiptRuleSetResp.abstract: Represents the details of the specified receipt rule set.

Classes/AWSSESDestination.html.name: AWSSESDestination
Classes/AWSSESDestination.html.abstract:
Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and BCC: fields.

Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in RFC6531. For this reason, the email address string must be 7-bit ASCII. If you want to send to or from email addresses that contain Unicode characters in the domain part of an address, you must encode the domain using Punycode. Punycode is not permitted in the local part of the email address (the part before the @ sign) nor in the “friendly from” name. If you want to use Unicode characters in the “friendly from” name, you must encode the “friendly from” name using MIME encoded-word syntax, as described in Sending raw email using the Amazon SES API. For more information about Punycode, see RFC 3492.

Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html.name: AWSSESEventDestination
Classes/AWSSESEventDestination.html.abstract:
Contains information about an event destination.

When you create or update an event destination, you must provide one, and only one, destination. The destination can be Amazon CloudWatch, Amazon Kinesis Firehose or Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

Event destinations are associated with configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch, Amazon Kinesis Firehose, or Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS). For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESExtensionField.html.name: AWSSESExtensionField
Classes/AWSSESExtensionField.html.abstract:
Additional X-headers to include in the Delivery Status Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your behalf bounces.

For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESGetAccountSendingEnabledRe.name: AWSSESGetAccountSendingEnabledResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetAccountSendingEnabledRe.abstract: Represents a request to return the email sending status for your Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.name: AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmailTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.abstract: Represents a request to retrieve an existing custom verification email template.

Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.name: AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmailTemplateResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetCustomVerificationEmail.abstract: The content of the custom verification email template.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.name: AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesRequest
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.abstract: Represents a request for the status of Amazon SES Easy DKIM signing for an identity. For domain identities, this request also returns the DKIM tokens that are required for Easy DKIM signing, and whether Amazon SES successfully verified that these tokens were published. For more information about Easy DKIM, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.name: AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityDkimAttributesR.abstract: Represents the status of Amazon SES Easy DKIM signing for an identity. For domain identities, this response also contains the DKIM tokens that are required for Easy DKIM signing, and whether Amazon SES successfully verified that these tokens were published.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.name: AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainAttributesRequest
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.abstract: Represents a request to return the Amazon SES custom MAIL FROM attributes for a list of identities. For information about using a custom MAIL FROM domain, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.name: AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainAttributesResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityMailFromDomainA.abstract: Represents the custom MAIL FROM attributes for a list of identities.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAtt.name: AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAttributesRequest
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAtt.abstract: Represents a request to return the notification attributes for a list of identities you verified with Amazon SES. For information about Amazon SES notifications, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAtt.name: AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAttributesResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityNotificationAtt.abstract: Represents the notification attributes for a list of identities.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityPoliciesRequest.name: AWSSESGetIdentityPoliciesRequest
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityPoliciesRequest.abstract: Represents a request to return the requested sending authorization policies for an identity. Sending authorization is an Amazon SES feature that enables you to authorize other senders to use your identities. For information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityVerificationAtt.name: AWSSESGetIdentityVerificationAttributesRequest
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityVerificationAtt.abstract: Represents a request to return the Amazon SES verification status of a list of identities. For domain identities, this request also returns the verification token. For information about verifying identities with Amazon SES, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityVerificationAtt.name: AWSSESGetIdentityVerificationAttributesResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetIdentityVerificationAtt.abstract: The Amazon SES verification status of a list of identities. For domain identities, this response also contains the verification token.

Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html.name: AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetSendQuotaResponse.html.abstract: Represents your Amazon SES daily sending quota, maximum send rate, and the number of emails you have sent in the last 24 hours.

Classes/AWSSESGetSendStatisticsResponse..name: AWSSESGetSendStatisticsResponse
Classes/AWSSESGetSendStatisticsResponse..abstract: Represents a list of data points. This list contains aggregated data from the previous two weeks of your sending activity with Amazon SES.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.name: AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes
Classes/AWSSESIdentityDkimAttributes.htm.abstract: Represents the DKIM attributes of a verified email address or a domain.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.name: AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
Classes/AWSSESIdentityMailFromDomainAttr.abstract: Represents the custom MAIL FROM domain attributes of a verified identity (email address or domain).

Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.name: AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttributes
Classes/AWSSESIdentityNotificationAttrib.abstract: Represents the notification attributes of an identity, including whether an identity has Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topics set for bounce, complaint, and/or delivery notifications, and whether feedback forwarding is enabled for bounce and complaint notifications.

Classes/AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttrib.name: AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttributes
Classes/AWSSESIdentityVerificationAttrib.abstract: Represents the verification attributes of a single identity.

Classes/AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination.name: AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination
Classes/AWSSESKinesisFirehoseDestination.abstract:
Contains the delivery stream ARN and the IAM role ARN associated with an Amazon Kinesis Firehose event destination.

Event destinations, such as Amazon Kinesis Firehose, are associated with configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html.name: AWSSESLambdaAction
Classes/AWSSESLambdaAction.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action calls an Amazon Web Services Lambda function and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

To enable Amazon SES to call your Amazon Web Services Lambda function or to publish to an Amazon SNS topic of another account, Amazon SES must have permission to access those resources. For information about giving permissions, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

For information about using Amazon Web Services Lambda actions in receipt rules, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsReque.name: AWSSESListConfigurationSetsRequest
Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsReque.abstract: Represents a request to list the configuration sets associated with your Amazon Web Services account. Configuration sets enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsRespo.name: AWSSESListConfigurationSetsResponse
Classes/AWSSESListConfigurationSetsRespo.abstract: A list of configuration sets associated with your Amazon Web Services account. Configuration sets enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.name: AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmailTemplatesRequest
Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.abstract:
Represents a request to list the existing custom verification email templates for your account.

For more information about custom verification email templates, see Using Custom Verification Email Templates in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.name: AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmailTemplatesResponse
Classes/AWSSESListCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: A paginated list of custom verification email templates.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest.html.name: AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest
Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesRequest.html.abstract: Represents a request to return a list of all identities (email addresses and domains) that you have attempted to verify under your Amazon Web Services account, regardless of verification status.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesResponse.htm.name: AWSSESListIdentitiesResponse
Classes/AWSSESListIdentitiesResponse.htm.abstract: A list of all identities that you have attempted to verify under your Amazon Web Services account, regardless of verification status.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesReques.name: AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesRequest
Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesReques.abstract: Represents a request to return a list of sending authorization policies that are attached to an identity. Sending authorization is an Amazon SES feature that enables you to authorize other senders to use your identities. For information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesRespon.name: AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesResponse
Classes/AWSSESListIdentityPoliciesRespon.abstract: A list of names of sending authorization policies that apply to an identity.
