Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESListReceip.abstract: Represents a request to list the IP address filters that exist under your Amazon Web Services account. You use IP address filters when you receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptFiltersResponse.name: AWSSESListReceiptFiltersResponse
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptFiltersResponse.abstract: A list of IP address filters that exist under your Amazon Web Services account.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRequest.name: AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRequest
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRequest.abstract: Represents a request to list the receipt rule sets that exist under your Amazon Web Services account. You use receipt rule sets to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRespons.name: AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsResponse
Classes/AWSSESListReceiptRuleSetsRespons.abstract: A list of receipt rule sets that exist under your Amazon Web Services account.

Classes/AWSSESListVerifiedEmailAddresses.name: AWSSESListVerifiedEmailAddressesResponse
Classes/AWSSESListVerifiedEmailAddresses.abstract: A list of email addresses that you have verified with Amazon SES under your Amazon Web Services account.

Classes/AWSSESMessage.html.name: AWSSESMessage
Classes/AWSSESMessage.html.abstract: Represents the message to be sent, composed of a subject and a body.

Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html.name: AWSSESMessageDsn
Classes/AWSSESMessageDsn.html.abstract:
Message-related information to include in the Delivery Status Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your behalf bounces.

For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESMessageTag.html.name: AWSSESMessageTag
Classes/AWSSESMessageTag.html.abstract:
Contains the name and value of a tag that you can provide to SendEmail or SendRawEmail to apply to an email.

Message tags, which you use with configuration sets, enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESPutConfigurationSetDeliver.name: AWSSESPutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsRequest
Classes/AWSSESPutConfigurationSetDeliver.abstract: A request to modify the delivery options for a configuration set.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESPutConfigu.name: AWSSESPutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESPutConfigu.abstract: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.name: AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest
Classes/AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyRequest.h.abstract: Represents a request to add or update a sending authorization policy for an identity. Sending authorization is an Amazon SES feature that enables you to authorize other senders to use your identities. For information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESPutIdentit.name: AWSSESPutIdentityPolicyResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESPutIdentit.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESRawMessage.html.name: AWSSESRawMessage
Classes/AWSSESRawMessage.html.abstract: Represents the raw data of the message.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html.name: AWSSESReceiptAction
Classes/AWSSESReceiptAction.html.abstract:
An action that Amazon SES can take when it receives an email on behalf of one or more email addresses or domains that you own. An instance of this data type can represent only one action.

For information about setting up receipt rules, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptFilter.html.name: AWSSESReceiptFilter
Classes/AWSSESReceiptFilter.html.abstract:
A receipt IP address filter enables you to specify whether to accept or reject mail originating from an IP address or range of IP addresses.

For information about setting up IP address filters, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptIpFilter.html.name: AWSSESReceiptIpFilter
Classes/AWSSESReceiptIpFilter.html.abstract:
A receipt IP address filter enables you to specify whether to accept or reject mail originating from an IP address or range of IP addresses.

For information about setting up IP address filters, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html.name: AWSSESReceiptRule
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRule.html.abstract:
Receipt rules enable you to specify which actions Amazon SES should take when it receives mail on behalf of one or more email addresses or domains that you own.

Each receipt rule defines a set of email addresses or domains that it applies to. If the email addresses or domains match at least one recipient address of the message, Amazon SES executes all of the receipt rule’s actions on the message.

For information about setting up receipt rules, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata.htm.name: AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata
Classes/AWSSESReceiptRuleSetMetadata.htm.abstract:
Information about a receipt rule set.

A receipt rule set is a collection of rules that specify what Amazon SES should do with mail it receives on behalf of your account’s verified domains.

For information about setting up receipt rule sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html.name: AWSSESRecipientDsnFields
Classes/AWSSESRecipientDsnFields.html.abstract:
Recipient-related information to include in the Delivery Status Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your behalf bounces.

For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetReque.name: AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetRequest
Classes/AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetReque.abstract: Represents a request to reorder the receipt rules within a receipt rule set. You use receipt rule sets to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESReorderRec.name: AWSSESReorderReceiptRuleSetResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESReorderRec.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html.name: AWSSESReputationOptions
Classes/AWSSESReputationOptions.html.abstract: Contains information about the reputation settings for a configuration set.

Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html.name: AWSSESS3Action
Classes/AWSSESS3Action.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action saves the received message to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

To enable Amazon SES to write emails to your Amazon S3 bucket, use an Amazon Web Services KMS key to encrypt your emails, or publish to an Amazon SNS topic of another account, Amazon SES must have permission to access those resources. For information about granting permissions, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

When you save your emails to an Amazon S3 bucket, the maximum email size (including headers) is 40 MB. Emails larger than that bounces.

For information about specifying Amazon S3 actions in receipt rules, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSNSAction.html.name: AWSSESSNSAction
Classes/AWSSESSNSAction.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS). This action includes a complete copy of the email content in the Amazon SNS notifications. Amazon SNS notifications for all other actions simply provide information about the email. They do not include the email content itself.

If you own the Amazon SNS topic, you don’t need to do anything to give Amazon SES permission to publish emails to it. However, if you don’t own the Amazon SNS topic, you need to attach a policy to the topic to give Amazon SES permissions to access it. For information about giving permissions, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

You can only publish emails that are 150 KB or less (including the header) to Amazon SNS. Larger emails bounce. If you anticipate emails larger than 150 KB, use the S3 action instead.

For information about using a receipt rule to publish an Amazon SNS notification, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSNSDestination.html.name: AWSSESSNSDestination
Classes/AWSSESSNSDestination.html.abstract:
Contains the topic ARN associated with an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) event destination.

Event destinations, such as Amazon SNS, are associated with configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html.name: AWSSESSendBounceRequest
Classes/AWSSESSendBounceRequest.html.abstract: Represents a request to send a bounce message to the sender of an email you received through Amazon SES.

Classes/AWSSESSendBulkTemplatedEmailRequ.name: AWSSESSendBulkTemplatedEmailRequest
Classes/AWSSESSendBulkTemplatedEmailRequ.abstract: Represents a request to send a templated email to multiple destinations using Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSendCustomVerificationEmai.name: AWSSESSendCustomVerificationEmailRequest
Classes/AWSSESSendCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: Represents a request to send a custom verification email to a specified recipient.

Classes/AWSSESSendCustomVerificationEmai.name: AWSSESSendCustomVerificationEmailResponse
Classes/AWSSESSendCustomVerificationEmai.abstract: The response received when attempting to send the custom verification email.

Classes/AWSSESSendDataPoint.html.name: AWSSESSendDataPoint
Classes/AWSSESSendDataPoint.html.abstract: Represents sending statistics data. Each SendDataPoint contains statistics for a 15-minute period of sending activity.

Classes/AWSSESSendEmailRequest.html.name: AWSSESSendEmailRequest
Classes/AWSSESSendEmailRequest.html.abstract: Represents a request to send a single formatted email using Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSendRawEmailRequest.html.name: AWSSESSendRawEmailRequest
Classes/AWSSESSendRawEmailRequest.html.abstract: Represents a request to send a single raw email using Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSendTemplatedEmailRequest..name: AWSSESSendTemplatedEmailRequest
Classes/AWSSESSendTemplatedEmailRequest..abstract: Represents a request to send a templated email using Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESSetActiveReceiptRuleSetReq.name: AWSSESSetActiveReceiptRuleSetRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetActiveReceiptRuleSetReq.abstract: Represents a request to set a receipt rule set as the active receipt rule set. You use receipt rule sets to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetActiveR.name: AWSSESSetActiveReceiptRuleSetResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetActiveR.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityDkimEnabledRequ.name: AWSSESSetIdentityDkimEnabledRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityDkimEnabledRequ.abstract: Represents a request to enable or disable Amazon SES Easy DKIM signing for an identity. For more information about setting up Easy DKIM, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.name: AWSSESSetIdentityDkimEnabledResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityFeedbackForward.name: AWSSESSetIdentityFeedbackForwardingEnabledRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityFeedbackForward.abstract: Represents a request to enable or disable whether Amazon SES forwards you bounce and complaint notifications through email. For information about email feedback forwarding, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.name: AWSSESSetIdentityFeedbackForwardingEnabledResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityHeadersInNotifi.name: AWSSESSetIdentityHeadersInNotificationsEnabledRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityHeadersInNotifi.abstract: Represents a request to set whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in the Amazon SNS notifications of a specified type. For information about notifications, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.name: AWSSESSetIdentityHeadersInNotificationsEnabledResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityMailFromDomainR.name: AWSSESSetIdentityMailFromDomainRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityMailFromDomainR.abstract: Represents a request to enable or disable the Amazon SES custom MAIL FROM domain setup for a verified identity. For information about using a custom MAIL FROM domain, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.name: AWSSESSetIdentityMailFromDomainResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityNotificationTop.name: AWSSESSetIdentityNotificationTopicRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetIdentityNotificationTop.abstract: Represents a request to specify the Amazon SNS topic to which Amazon SES publishes bounce, complaint, or delivery notifications for emails sent with that identity as the source. For information about Amazon SES notifications, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.name: AWSSESSetIdentityNotificationTopicResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetIdentit.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESSetReceiptRulePositionRequ.name: AWSSESSetReceiptRulePositionRequest
Classes/AWSSESSetReceiptRulePositionRequ.abstract: Represents a request to set the position of a receipt rule in a receipt rule set. You use receipt rule sets to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetReceipt.name: AWSSESSetReceiptRulePositionResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESSetReceipt.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESStopAction.html.name: AWSSESStopAction
Classes/AWSSESStopAction.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action terminates the evaluation of the receipt rule set and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

For information about setting a stop action in a receipt rule, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESTemplate.html.name: AWSSESTemplate
Classes/AWSSESTemplate.html.abstract: The content of the email, composed of a subject line and either an HTML part or a text-only part.

Classes/AWSSESTrackingOptions.html.name: AWSSESTrackingOptions
Classes/AWSSESTrackingOptions.html.abstract:
A domain that is used to redirect email recipients to an Amazon SES-operated domain. This domain captures open and click events generated by Amazon SES emails.

For more information, see Configuring Custom Domains to Handle Open and Click Tracking in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateAccountSendingEnable.name: AWSSESUpdateAccountSendingEnabledRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateAccountSendingEnable.abstract: Represents a request to enable or disable the email sending capabilities for your entire Amazon SES account.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetEven.name: AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetEven.abstract: Represents a request to update the event destination of a configuration set. Configuration sets enable you to publish email sending events. For information about using configuration sets, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESUpdateConf.name: AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESUpdateConf.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetRepu.name: AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetReputationMetricsEnabledRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetRepu.abstract: Represents a request to modify the reputation metric publishing settings for a configuration set.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetSend.name: AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabledRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetSend.abstract: Represents a request to enable or disable the email sending capabilities for a specific configuration set.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetTrac.name: AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetTrackingOptionsRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetTrac.abstract: Represents a request to update the tracking options for a configuration set.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESUpdateConf.name: AWSSESUpdateConfigurationSetTrackingOptionsResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESUpdateConf.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateCustomVerificationEm.name: AWSSESUpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateCustomVerificationEm.abstract: Represents a request to update an existing custom verification email template.

Classes/AWSSESUpdateReceiptRuleRequest.h.name: AWSSESUpdateReceiptRuleRequest
Classes/AWSSESUpdateReceiptRuleRequest.h.abstract: Represents a request to update a receipt rule. You use receipt rules to receive email with Amazon SES. For more information, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESUpdateRece.name: AWSSESUpdateReceiptRuleResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESUpdateRece.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainDkimRequest.ht.name: AWSSESVerifyDomainDkimRequest
Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainDkimRequest.ht.abstract: Represents a request to generate the CNAME records needed to set up Easy DKIM with Amazon SES. For more information about setting up Easy DKIM, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainDkimResponse.h.name: AWSSESVerifyDomainDkimResponse
Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainDkimResponse.h.abstract: Returns CNAME records that you must publish to the DNS server of your domain to set up Easy DKIM with Amazon SES.

Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainIdentityReques.name: AWSSESVerifyDomainIdentityRequest
Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainIdentityReques.abstract: Represents a request to begin Amazon SES domain verification and to generate the TXT records that you must publish to the DNS server of your domain to complete the verification. For information about domain verification, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainIdentityRespon.name: AWSSESVerifyDomainIdentityResponse
Classes/AWSSESVerifyDomainIdentityRespon.abstract: Returns a TXT record that you must publish to the DNS server of your domain to complete domain verification with Amazon SES.

Classes/AWSSESVerifyEmailAddressRequest..name: AWSSESVerifyEmailAddressRequest
Classes/AWSSESVerifyEmailAddressRequest..abstract: Represents a request to begin email address verification with Amazon SES. For information about email address verification, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSESVerifyEmailIdentityRequest.name: AWSSESVerifyEmailIdentityRequest
Classes/AWSSESVerifyEmailIdentityRequest.abstract: Represents a request to begin email address verification with Amazon SES. For information about email address verification, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESVerifyEmai.name: AWSSESVerifyEmailIdentityResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSSESVerifyEmai.abstract: An empty element returned on a successful request.

Classes/AWSSESWorkmailAction.html.name: AWSSESWorkmailAction
Classes/AWSSESWorkmailAction.html.abstract:
When included in a receipt rule, this action calls Amazon WorkMail and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS). It usually isn’t necessary to set this up manually, because Amazon WorkMail adds the rule automatically during its setup procedure.

For information using a receipt rule to call Amazon WorkMail, see the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSSES.html.name: AWSSES
Classes/AWSSES.html.abstract:
Amazon Simple Email Service

This document contains reference information for the Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES) API, version 2010-12-01. This document is best used in conjunction with the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

For a list of Amazon SES endpoints to use in service requests, see Regions and Amazon SES in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

This documentation contains reference information related to the following:

  • Amazon SES API Actions

  • Amazon SES API Data Types

  • Common Parameters

  • Common Errors
